thread.title: CBS shifts 'Angel,' '2 Broke Girls' premieres

title: CBS shifts 'Angel,' '2 Broke Girls' premieres
text:
Maggie Lawson, left, and Jane Lynch star in CBS' 'Angel From Hell.' (Photo: Cliff Lipson, CBS)
9 CONNECT 9 TWEET LINKEDIN 2 COMMENT EMAIL MORE One of CBS' new fall shows will now premiere in midseason.
The network Wednesday pushed back Angel from Hell 's first episode from November until February. Fifth-season comedy, 2 Broke Girls , which was scheduled for a midseason return, will take Angel 's slot, premiering Nov. 12.
Broke Girls will be part of a CBS scripted lineup that replaces NFL games when the network's Thursday football schedule finishes its run in November.
On Nov. 5, the network's lineup will open with The Big Bang Theory and freshman Life in Pieces , which both move from Monday. They will be followed by the Season 3 premiere of Mom and a Big Bang rerun, leading into the fourth-season premiere of Elementary . On Nov. 12, Broke Girls ' Season 5 opener will fill the Big Bang rerun slot at 9:30 p.m. ET/PT.
USA TODAY
Meet 'Hell's' angel
Angel From Hell stars Jane Lynch as Amy, a larger-than-life, booze-swilling woman who claims to be the guardian angel of Allison (Maggie Lawson), an intense, young doctor.
